parts: I want to set up a Google Cloud Project and have one of my customers pay for the project directly.  I already have a Google Cloud organization.  What do I need to do, what does he need to do
flattened: I want to set up a Google Cloud Project and have one of my customers pay for the project directly.  I already have a Google Cloud organization.  What do I need to do, what does he need to do

parts:
To have your **customer directly pay for a Google Cloud project that you manage**, you can take the following approach. Since you already have a **Google Cloud Organization**, here's a clean breakdown of what **you need to do** and what **your customer needs to do**.

---

### ‚úÖ You Need to Do:

#### 1. **Create a New Google Cloud Project**
- Under your existing Organization (via the Google Cloud Console or `gcloud` CLI).

#### 2. **Create a New Billing Account (Optional)**
- If the customer will **own the billing account**, **you don't do this** ‚Äî your customer will.
- If they want to **give you access to an existing billing account**, they‚Äôll need to add you as a Billing Account User or Admin.

#### 3. **Give the Customer Billing Permissions**
There are **two common models** here ‚Äî choose one based on trust and control:

---

#### üîπ **Option A: Customer Owns the Billing Account**

**They do this:**
- Go to [Google Cloud Console ‚Üí Billing](https://console.cloud.google.com/billing)
- Create a **new billing account** if they don‚Äôt have one.
- Add **you (or a service account you control)** as a **Billing Account User** (role: `roles/billing.user`) or **Billing Account Admin** (role: `roles/billing.admin`) if they want you to link projects.
  - This is done under **Billing ‚Üí Account Management ‚Üí Permissions**.

**You do this:**
- Link your GCP project to their billing account:
  - Go to **Billing ‚Üí My Projects ‚Üí Change billing account**
  - Choose their account (you‚Äôll only see it if you‚Äôve been granted permission).

---

#### üîπ **Option B: They Own the Project Directly**

This is only if **they want full ownership**, and you act as a contractor.

**They do this:**
- Create the project under their billing account.
- Add **you** to the project with the necessary IAM roles (e.g., `Editor`, `Owner`, or a custom role).

**You do:**
- Manage the project as needed.

This is clean, but you lose project ownership/control.

---

### ‚úÖ Your Customer Needs to Do:

- **Option A**: Own or create a **billing account**, and give you permission to attach your project to it.
- **Option B**: Create the project and let you work inside it by granting IAM roles.

---

### ‚ùóImportant Notes:
- **Billing accounts are global**, not tied to an organization.
- Projects can only be linked to **one billing account** at a time.
- **Billing account ownership = payment responsibility.**
- If using **committed use discounts**, credits apply only at the billing account level.
- Google Cloud support and quotas depend on billing setup too.

---

### Recommendation:
If you want to **retain control of the project** while your customer pays, go with **Option A** ‚Äî you create the project, and they own the billing account.

Would you like help drafting a message or guide to send to your customer so they know what to do?
